that is not how you would do that.
startx starts an X server on the local hardware.
sorry - I don't know that can work that way.  you are trying to access the computer remotely?  is there already a logon to that computer?
you can run an application remotely over ssh -X by just typing in its command name.  Like to run firefox remotely: "ssh -X user@host"  then at the prompt "firefox &"
I am almost positive startx starts an X server on the remote computer's hardware, not over ssh
